intro: Mentzelia citrina, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds. Mentzelia citrina is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a short-lived perennial.
